forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 25. West wind around 13 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 32. West wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph.

weather_report:
In the stillness of the night, Boston awaits the dawn when clarity will seize the day. Currently, the city basks under a tapestry of mostly clear skies, conditions whispering of a chill typical for January. With a low temperature lingering around 25 degrees, the air carries the crispness of winter, accompanied by a gentle west wind that dances at 13 miles per hour. There’s a silence to the streets, as if the city is holding its breath, soaking in the quiet anticipation of the sunny morning ahead.

Come Tuesday, the sun will illuminate the skyline, painting a vivid picture against the cold backdrop with temperatures inching toward a high of 32. The breeze will pick up, gusting as high as 30 miles per hour, adding a layer of invigorating freshness that sweetens the atmosphere. It’s a day that beckons one to wrap up warmly—think layered sweaters beneath hearty coats, complemented by a well-worn scarf and sturdy boots that can withstand the brisk chill. The inviting sun will be a perfect excuse to stroll along the river, perhaps finding a hidden café that beckons with the promise of a good book and a steaming cup of coffee. Engaging with the day’s tranquility while wrapped in warmth offers an escape from the jagged edges of winter, making it a splendid chance to embrace the subtle beauty of Boston in January.
